body:
The run name is just a tag under run and an attribute in `run.info`. You can write a simple function like this:
```python
import mlflow
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
from mlflow.entities.run_status import RunStatus

def set_run_name(run_id, run_name):
    run = mlflow.get_run(run_id)
    client = MlflowClient()
    client.set_tag(run_id, "mlflow.runName", run_name)
    client._tracking_client.store.update_run_info(
        run_id=run_id,
        run_status=RunStatus.from_string(run.info.status),
        end_time=run.info.end_time,
        run_name=run_name,
    )
```

Anyway, I don't know if this functionality is planned by the dev team. I have drafted an implementation as below, tested with FileStore and Postgres Store. If the dev team deems it desirable, I am happy to finish up the docstring & test cases and create a PR.
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/compare/master...gabrielfu:mlflow:feat/rename_run

@gabrielfu  Thanks!

I'm fine with this solution (tested with a server on top of sqlite)

BUT I got an exception with the `run_name` parameter to update_run_info  (I'm using MLFlow 1.29)
`TypeError: RestStore.update_run_info() got an unexpected keyword argument 'run_name'`

So the rename function is as below and works fine.

```
import mlflow
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
from mlflow.entities.run_status import RunStatus

client = MlflowClient(sServerURI)

def set_run_name(client, run_id, run_name):
    run = client.get_run(run_id)
    client.set_tag(run_id, "mlflow.runName", run_name)
    client._tracking_client.store.update_run_info(
        run_id=run_id,
        run_status=RunStatus.from_string(run.info.status),
        end_time=run.info.end_time,
        #run_name=run_name,
    )
```

So here is the command I needed. Happy to share this small piece of Python code.
JL

[do_mlflow_run_rename.py.zip](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/9684335/do_mlflow_run_rename.py.zip)

```
"""
Utility for mass-renaming of runs in an experiment.

Jean-Luc Meunier
"""

import sys, os
import re
import logging
import argparse

import mlflow
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
from mlflow.entities.run_status import RunStatus
from mlflow.entities import ViewType


logging.basicConfig() # otherwise cannot change logging level... crazy
logger = logging.getLogger('.')
logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)


def rename_run(client, run_id, run_name):
    # thanks to gabrielfu 
    run = client.get_run(run_id)
    client.set_tag(run_id, "mlflow.runName", run_name)
    client._tracking_client.store.update_run_info(
        run_id=run_id,
        run_status=RunStatus.from_string(run.info.status),
        end_time=run.info.end_time,
        #run_name=run_name,
    )
    return "done"


if __name__ == "__main__":
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(usage="""
Rename one or several runs from an experiment, given by its experiment id EXP_ID.
The runs to be renamed are selected thanks to a regular expression (the RUN_SELECTOR).
For renaming, the given TERM is replaced by the given REPLACEMENT.

Example:
python do_mlflow_run_rename.py 6 'toto.*foo' foo bar

""")
    parser.add_argument('--uri'
                        , default=None
                        , help='MLFlow server URI (default: %(default)s) By default, read the MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI environment variable')
    # How to select the experiment(s) and the run(s)
    parser.add_argument('exp_id', metavar="EXP_ID"
                        , help='the experience id')
    parser.add_argument('run_name_selector', metavar="RUN_SELECTOR"
                        , help='Regular expression to select the run(s). Must match the full run name. ($ is added automatically at the end)')
    parser.add_argument('term', metavar="TERM_TO_REPLACE"
                        , help='The substring to be replaced')
    parser.add_argument('replacement', metavar="REPLACEMENT"
                        , help='The replacement')
    parser.add_argument('--debug', '-n', action="store_true"
                        , help='Dry run. Only prints what would be done')
    parser.add_argument('--verbose', '-v', action="store_true"
                        , help='Verbose mode')

    args = parser.parse_args()

    if args.debug: logger.info("----- DRY RUN MODE -----")

    sServerURI = args.uri if args.uri else os.getenv("MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI")
    client = MlflowClient(sServerURI)

    lRun = client.search_runs([args.exp_id]
                            , run_view_type=ViewType.ACTIVE_ONLY     # DELETED_ONLY ALL
                            , max_results=1000)
    logger.info(f"{len(lRun)} runs in experiment {args.exp_id}")

    # filter by run name
    run_name_selector = args.run_name_selector
    if run_name_selector[-1] != '$': run_name_selector += '$' 
    cre = re.compile(run_name_selector)

    n = 0
    for run in lRun:
        name = run.data.tags['mlflow.runName']
        newname = name.replace(args.term, args.replacement)
        if cre.match(name):
            if name != newname:
                run_id = run.info.run_id
                if args.debug:
                    logger.info(f"WOULD RENAME: '{name}' --> '{newname}'")
                else:
                    n += 1
                    logger.info(f"RENAMING: '{name}' --> '{newname}'   {rename_run(client, run_id, newname)}")
            elif args.verbose or args.debug:
                logger.info(f"No change, ignored: {name}  {newname}")
        else:
            if args.verbose or args.debug:
                logger.info(f"Ignored: {name}")
    logger.info(f"{n} renaming done")
```

Hi @jlmeunier, we'd be very excited about introducing an `MlflowClient.update_run()` API which can be used to set the status of a run (e.g. running, finished, failed) and / or the run's name, mirroring the UpdateRun API definition which was recently updated on the `master` branch: https://output.circle-artifacts.com/output/job/dcaa1233-23f2-4081-b4fe-22993114ddf8/artifacts/0/docs/build/html/rest-api.html#update-run.

I think the following API signature would be great:

```
def update_run(self, run_id, status=None, name=None):
    """
    :param run_id: The ID of the Run to update.
    :param status: The new status of the run to set, if specified. At least one of ``status`` or ``name`` should be specified.
    :param name: The new name of the run to set, if specified. At least one of ``name`` or ``status`` should be specified.
    """
```

We can implement this by calling through to `self.store.update_run_info()`, as is done here: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/df327134d1278f98b6142ddaef77295a146aba18/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py#L470-L475

The API should be introduced to https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/tracking/client.py and https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py, and it can be tested in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/tracking/test_client.py.

Thank you in advance for your contribution, and please let me know if you have any questions!

> @gabrielfu Thanks!
> 
> I'm fine with this solution (tested with a server on top of sqlite)
> 
> BUT I got an exception with the `run_name` parameter to update_run_info (I'm using MLFlow 1.29) `TypeError: RestStore.update_run_info() got an unexpected keyword argument 'run_name'`
> 
> So the rename function is as below and works fine.
> 
> ```
> import mlflow
> from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
> from mlflow.entities.run_status import RunStatus
> 
> client = MlflowClient(sServerURI)
> 
> def set_run_name(client, run_id, run_name):
>     run = client.get_run(run_id)
>     client.set_tag(run_id, "mlflow.runName", run_name)
>     client._tracking_client.store.update_run_info(
>         run_id=run_id,
>         run_status=RunStatus.from_string(run.info.status),
>         end_time=run.info.end_time,
>         #run_name=run_name,
>     )
> ```

Interestinig, as below `RestStore.update_run_info()` does have `run_name` argument. Which `mlflow` version are you using?

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/42fc25dbc0e32d58669be4e3024f30b46b2c40a1/mlflow/store/tracking/rest_store.py#L166

@dbczumar great suggestion
@jlmeunier are you interested in working on this? if not, do you mind me doing it? :)
@gabrielfu Given that 1 week has passed, feel free to start working on this. Thank you in advance for your contribution!
